etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in John Hill (bap. 1714, d. 1775), physician and actor. From scientific Latin Callicarpa, genus name (LinnaeusSpecies Plantarum I. 111) from ancient Greek καλλίκαρπος bearing fine fruit (from καλλι-, combining form of κάλλος beauty + καρπός fruit: see carpo-) + scientific Latin -a

definitions: Any of numerous ornamental shrubs of the genus Callicarpa (family Lamiaceae (Labiatae), formerly Verbenaceae), which comprises the beautyberries; such shrubs collectively. Also (in form Callicarpa): the genus itself.
